text: I remember playing the original Spelunky a loooong time ago, and so when this first came out on XBLA, I invited a friend over and we played co-op for hours. One of my favorite gaming experiences!
author: Kite

text: This is an interesting track. It sounds like they were kinda striving for a 16-bit sound, which you don't often see in current games. You mostly see people going for an 8-bit sound, as it's the "most retro" I suppose.
author: Moop Bread

text: It's got that Genesis vibe to it.
author: Moop Bread

text: The composer said the music was supposed to have that vibe to mirror how the game has HD graphics but still uses tiles like a 16-bit game.

text: I loved this game on xbox arcade
author: Everlasting

text: I'm not a big roguelike﻿ fan, but there are some exceptions like Spelunky which I played extensively on the Xbox 360 (Binding of Isaac is another roguelike I love). Extremely addictive. Not many games know how to be pleasantly hard and challenging, but this is certainly the case with Spelunky. The music's available on Suhrke's bandcamp, but he unfortunately only uploaded 1 loop for each track, making for a lot of <1 minute tracks. I looped this once.
author: SupraDarky
